glsa.title: Pavuk: Multiple buffer overflows
glsa.synopsis: Pavuk contains multiple buffer overflows that can allow a remote attacker to run arbitrary code.

background.p: Pavuk is web spider and website mirroring tool.

description.p: Pavuk contains several buffer overflow vulnerabilities in the code handling digest authentication and HTTP header processing. This issue is similar to GLSA 200407-19, but contains more vulnerabilities.

impact.p: A remote attacker could cause a buffer overflow, leading to arbitrary code execution with the rights of the user running Pavuk.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Pavuk users should upgrade to the latest version:
